headline.main: American Sleep Patterns Vary by Age, Race and Place, Study Finds

docs.lead_paragraph: About 65 percent of Americans get at least seven hours of sleep each night, the threshold that a new survey’s authors used to define a healthy rest.
docs.snippet: About 65 percent of Americans get at least seven hours of sleep each night, the threshold that a new survey’s authors used to define a healthy rest.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

headline.print_headline: Report: Hawaii Leads Nation in Getting Too Little Sleep
headline.main: Report: Hawaii Leads Nation in Getting Too Little Sleep

docs.lead_paragraph: Tired of hearing that more than a third of U.S. adults don't get enough sleep? Here's something new: a government report about which states get the most sack time.
docs.snippet: Tired of hearing that more than a third of U.S. adults don't get enough sleep? Here's something new: a government report about which states get the most sack time.

headline.print_headline: How de Blasio Sees America:  as Pastrami
headline.main: Mayor de Blasio’s America: A Pastrami Sandwich From Carnegie Deli

docs.abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio sends out picture of pastrami sandwich from Carnegie Deli in Manhattan on Twitter, accompanied by word America; tweet is response to one from Jeb Bush in which he also used America to caption image of gun engraved with his name.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s tweet celebrated the deli’s reopening and mocked Jeb Bush’s use of the same message with a picture of a handgun.
docs.snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s tweet celebrated the deli’s reopening and mocked Jeb Bush’s use of the same message with a picture of a handgun.
